title: Add a logger
description:
This needs to output relevant but succinct information to the console on every API operation.
There should also be the possibility to control the log level on entry, so "openDatabase" .

features.title: Create a simple logger utility
features.description: Create a new file `src/logger.ts` that exports a `createLogger` function. This function should accept a `LogLevel` ('debug', 'info', 'warn', 'error', 'silent') and return a logger object with corresponding methods (`debug`, `info`, `warn`, `error`). The logger will use the console but will only output messages for its configured level and above. Also, update `src/types.ts` to include the necessary `LogLevel` and `Logger` types.

features.title: Integrate logger into the Database API
features.description: Update the `OpenDbOptions` interface in `src/types.ts` to accept an optional `logLevel` property. In `src/index.ts`, within the `openDatabase` function, instantiate the logger using `createLogger` and the provided `logLevel` (defaulting to 'info'). The logger instance should be made available to the database methods.

features.title: Add log statements to all public API methods
features.description: In `src/index.ts`, add an 'info' level log statement at the beginning of each public API method (e.g., `addDocument`, `getDocumentById`, `searchDocuments`, `addEntity`, etc.). The log messages should be succinct, indicating the operation being performed and key parameters, such as IDs or search queries.
